normalised: Hey everyone, did you know our waste management is getting a much-needed makeover? The I I T-Delhi is piloting a new composting system specifically designed for dealing with the tonnes of organic waste generated from weddings – think all those leftover biryani and mithai!

unnormalised: Hey everyone, did you know our waste management is getting a much-needed makeover? The IIT-Delhi is piloting a new composting system specifically designed for dealing with the tonnes of organic waste generated from weddings – think all those leftover biryani and mithai!
normalised: Apparently, overflowing landfills are a bigger problem than a bad Bollywood remake these days. And no one wants to end up like "Wall-E" with mountains of trash, right?

unnormalised: Apparently, overflowing landfills are a bigger problem than a bad Bollywood remake these days. And no one wants to end up like "Wall-E" with mountains of trash, right?
normalised: This I I T project aims to dramatically reduce the amount of garbage going to the Ghazipur landfill, which, let's be honest, isn't exactly a picnic spot. They’re focusing on creating high-quality compost that can then be used by farmers in Haryana, reducing their reliance on chemical fertilizers.

unnormalised: This IIT project aims to dramatically reduce the amount of garbage going to the Ghazipur landfill, which, let's be honest, isn't exactly a picnic spot. They’re focusing on creating high-quality compost that can then be used by farmers in Haryana, reducing their reliance on chemical fertilizers.
normalised: The system can process approximately five hundred kilogram of waste per day, turning food scraps and floral decorations into nutrient-rich soil in about two weeks. Imagine, turning those discarded marigolds into something useful! There are plans to scale this up and implement it across major wedding venues in Delhi N C R. Fingers crossed we see cleaner cities soon! This could be a game-changer, truly. Jai Hind!

unnormalised: The system can process approximately 500 kg of waste per day, turning food scraps and floral decorations into nutrient-rich soil in about 2 weeks. Imagine, turning those discarded marigolds into something useful! There are plans to scale this up and implement it across major wedding venues in Delhi NCR. Fingers crossed we see cleaner cities soon! This could be a game-changer, truly. Jai Hind!
